title.narrative: STRENGTHENED SYSTEMS FOR SOCIAL DATA

description.narrative: By 2016, 5 countries have strengthened national systems (admin data and survey plan) for the production of social data on children in at least the Child Protection and Education sectors, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Equity-sensitive national policies, programmes and budget allocations are made based on reliable, disaggregated data reflecting the actual situation of girls and boys and their families in line with the CRC, CEDAW and the Millennium Development Goals. By 2014, all countries will have fulfilled their Convention reporting obligations and by 2016 will have taken actions to comply with all Concluding Observations of the Committee on the Rights of the Child

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, 5 countries have strengthened national systems (admin data and survey plan) for the production of social data on childrenin at least the Child Protection and Education sectors

description.narrative: Data analysis and collection efforts such as multi-country child poverty analysis, ECD data snapshots, Child Protection baseline assessment and Situation Analysis of Children contributed to increased availability of data on children for evidence-based decision making | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2017

title.narrative: No. of country-led evalutions conducted in five countries

target.value: 2016:Target 2014 : 3, Target 2016 : 5 Evaluations (St.Lucia, Dominica, Grenada, St. Vincent and the Grenadines, Trinidad and Tobago)

actual.value: 2016:No evaluation planned in 2016. Follow up continued during 2016 on the findings of the ECHO and Highscope evaluations conducted in 2015. Initiated preparations for conducting the impact evaluation of the pilot MEND and RISE cash transfer programmes in 2017.

title.narrative: No of countries with updated and disaggregated multi-dimensional data (MICS and other sources) on all girls and boys in Education and Protection sectors

actual.value: 2016:3 MICS surveys conducted in Barbados, Saint Lucia and Trinidad & Tobago.

title.narrative: No. of countries in which MICS (rounds 4 or 5) is completed

target.value: 2016:Target 2016: 6 (St.St.Lucia, Grenada, Dominica, Barbados, St.Vincent & Grenadines and Trinidad and Tobago)

actual.value: 2016:3 MICS surveys conducted in Barbados, Saint Lucia and Trinidad & Tobago. 2 reports (BB, SL) published. 1 report (Trinidad and Tobago) is final but still awaiting approval by the Cabinet.

title.narrative: No. of countries with updated situational analysis of the realization of the rights of children and women

actual.value: 2016:SITAN processes conducted in all 12 ECA countries/territories. 4 SITAN reports published (UK OTs), 8 reports are at various stages of advanced drafting.

title.narrative: No of countries with online DevInfo databases available for monitoring children's rights, especially those poor.

actual.value: 2016:5 ECA countries and territories (Anguilla, Barbados, Grenada, Monserrat, St. Lucia) and OECS Commission are developing adaptations of DevInfo databases.

title.narrative: No. of countries that have produced Education and CP statistical digests of the previous year data before the end of the current year

actual.value: 2016:OECS Education statistical digest produced annually with complete or partial data for 9 countries. 5 countries/territories developed individual Education statistical digests. Child Protection statistical digests published for 5 countries/territories.

title.narrative: National sectoral programmes based on evidence provided by disaggregated data on girls and boys

baseline.value: Education = 0 Countries, Child Protection = 0 Countries and Social Protection = 0 Countries

target.value: 2016:Education = 5 Countries, Child Protection = 3 Countries and Social Protection = 4 Countries

title.narrative: National sectoral policies based on evidence provided by disaggregated data on girls and boys

baseline.value: Education = 1 Country, Child Protection = 0 Countries, Social Protection = 1 Country

target.value: 2016:Education = 5 Countries, Child Protection = 3 Countries and Social Protection = 4 Countries

actual.value: 2016:SP: 3 - National Social Protection Policy, Plan of Action and Monitoring and Evaluation Framework in place in St. Kitts & Nevis and Grenada, and National Social Protection Policy in St. Lucia. Ed: 2 - Education Strategic Plan 2011–2014 and Education Development Plan for 2011 to 2020. CP: 0.

title.narrative: No. of countries in which national surveys with child-focus (MICS4 or adjusted LFS) have been completed

actual.value: 2016:3 MICS surveys conducted in Barbados, Saint Lucia and Trinidad & Tobago. 2 countries (St Lucia and Grenada) tested a revised LFS that have few questions on children.

title.narrative: No. of countries with administrative data system in Education, Health and Protection, that produce up-to date sex and age disaggregated data on girls and boys

target.value: 2016:Target by 2014: 3 , Target 2016: 6 countries (St.Lucia, Grenada, Dominica, Barbados, St.Vincent & Grenadines and Trinidad and Tobago)

actual.value: 2016:All 12 countries and territories have increased production of disaggregated admin data. OECS Education statistical digest produced annually since 2012 with complete or partial data for 9 countries. Child Protection statistical digests published for 5 countries/territories and ECD data snapshot devel

title.narrative: No. of countries with Health, Education and Protection programs based on evidence (analysis) provided by disaggregated data on girls and boys
No of countries that produce research and position papers or thematic analysis on child poverty and disparities

actual.value: 2016:Multi-country child poverty analysis conducted for 10 ECA countries/ territories based on Survey of Living Conditions (SLC) data sets.

title.narrative: No of regional bodies/institutions (UWI, CARICOM, OECS, CDB, ECLAC) that produce research and position papers or thematic analysis on child poverty and disparities

actual.value: 2016:OECS Commission produced education statistical digest annually. Multi-country child poverty analysis summary report and interactive presentation is being developed for 10 ECA countries/ territories. CDB has released gender based country assessments. ECLAC produced analysis of the social and economic

title.narrative: No. of countries with national and sectoral ( Health, Education and Protection ) policies based on evidence provided by disaggregated data on girls and boys

actual.value: 2016:SP: 3 - National Social Protection Policy, Plan of Action and Monitoring and Evaluation Framework in place in St. Kitts & Nevis and Grenada, and National Social Protection Policy in St. Lucia. ED: 2 - Education Strategic Plan 2011–2014 and Education Development Plan for 2011 to 2020. CP: 0.
